ETD 2024

Hybrid Conference

27th International Symposium on Electronic Theses and Dissertations (ETD 2024)

November 4 - November 6, 2024 (Livingstone, Zambia)

Latest News

  • June 14, 2024

    The conference dates have been adjusted by a week. ETD 2024 will now be held between November 4 2024 and November 6 2024..

  • May 18, 2024

    We have extended the abstract submissions for the ETD 2024 symposium by another three (3) week, to June 7 2024. We are hopeful that this will enable those wishing to join us in Livingstone or virtually, to submit their abstracts. Please note that this is a final deadline extension.

  • Apr 26, 2024

    In response to numerous request, the paper/poster abstract and workshop proposal submission deadline for the ETD 2024 symposium has been extended to May 17 2024. It is hoped that this will give additional potential authors enough time to submit their work.

  • Mar 20, 2024

    The Call for Papers for ETD2024 is now open! Hosted by The University Of Zambia (UNZA), The Higher Education Authority of Zambia and The Zambia Research and Education Network (ZAMREN) and The Networked Digital Library of Theses and Dissertations (NDLTD), this year's topic is "Electronic Thesis and Dissertation Visibility at a Global Scale"
    We invite submissions on Application of Large Language Models to ETDs; Automatic Analysis of ETDs; ETD Implementation Use Cases; ETD Policies and Practices; ETDs and e-Infrastructures; ETDs and Long-term Preservation; ETDs and Open Access; ETDs and Open Science; ETDs and Persistent Identifiers; ETDs and Research Data; General Issues Related to ETDs; Global Visibility of ETDs; Graduate Education and Training; Institutional Repository Platforms; and National and Global ETD Initiatives
    The due date to submit abstracts is April 26, 2024.

ETD Visibility at a Global Scale

Join us, along with global leaders, from Monday, November 4th to Wednesday, November 6th, 2024 at Radisson Blu Mosi-Oa-Tunya Livingstone Resort, in Livingstone, Zambia for the 27thInternational Symposium on Electronic Theses and Dissertations. Learn about innovative approaches that make use of Electronic Theses and Dissertations (ETDs), including the use of modern-day Artificial Intelligence techniques such as Large Language Models and exploration of advances that will result in increased visibility of ETDs at a Global Scale.
The theme of ETD 2024 is "ETD Visibility at a Global Scale". Significant strides have been made in mainstreaming of ETDs, with a number of national and international initiatives initiated, however, the visibility of ETDs in other parts of the world is still low. In addition, the potential of ETDs beyond research and academia presents opportunities to enable more access to the knowledge contained within ETDs.
ETD 2024 2024 will be run in a hybrid mode: speakers and attendees will have the option to participate onsite or online.
